posts.post_content:
A no-cost tap to make something unblockable is a no-brainer, particularly for white/blue where your defense may be solid but need offensive help.
  
   
4/5

posts.post_content: The "target is unblockable" ability is also good for defense. If your opponent swings with a creature like Taunting Elf or Prized Unicorn (has to be blocked by every creature that can block it), you can make that creature unblockable so you can block their other creatures.

posts.post_content:
Reminds me of [Samite Archer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Samite Archer). They both have the same stats except for the second ability, which either lets you deal one damage or make a creature unblockable. Fun fact: the archer makes use of archaic blue color pie.  
This one's definitely useful as aforementioned for block-constructed use as well in Bant decks with *Exhalted* effects.

posts.post_content:
@salmonrose: Sure it's good in a Bant deck, but Naya decks tend not to run Blue since Naya's colors are RGW. If you're running this guy, I'm not sure I'd be calling it a Naya deck.  
  
Anyway, this guy helps get Rafiq through for some decent general damage. With all of the other exalted creatures and pumping enchantments like [Armadillo Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armadillo Cloak) and of course [Eldrazi Con\*\*\*ion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eldrazi Con***ion), this guy can help Rafiq excel as a Voltron commander.
